titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford in Germany Reunion Collection
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives
publicationstmt.p: Copyright Â© 2015 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. All rights reserved.

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: This collection includes materials from several classes of students who participated in Stanford's overseas program in Beutelsbach, Germany; they were identified as Group I, II, etc. Materials from Group I (1958 program) consist of two CDs of audio recordings (The Boerner Tapes) from 4 events celebrating the end of the first program, which include student remarks and interviews, songs and skits, and a farewell talk by Dr. Peter Boerner; and memorabilia from their 2008 reunion in Germany. Materials from Group II (1959) consist of a CD of scanned images from 1959 and their 2008 reunion; and reminiscences printed from their website, 2008. Materials from Group XVIII (1967) consist of their 40th Anniversary Memory Book, pdf of the book on disc, and 2 clippings from German newspapers about their reunion in Germany, 2007.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford in Germany Reunion Collection (SC0941). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: This collection includes materials from several classes of students who participated in Stanford's overseas program in Beutelsbach, Germany; they were identified as Group I, II, etc. Materials from Group I (1958 program) consist of two CDs of audio recordings (The Boerner Tapes) from 4 events celebrating the end of the first program, which include student remarks and interviews, songs and skits, and a farewell talk by Dr. Peter Boerner; and memorabilia from their 2008 reunion in Germany. Materials from Group II (1959) consist of a CD of scanned images from 1959 and their 2008 reunion; and reminiscences printed from their website, 2008. Materials from Group XVIII (1967) consist of their 40th Anniversary Memory Book, pdf of the book on disc, and 2 clippings from German newspapers about their reunion in Germany, 2007.
